_header: Whoso will over read this book
Note: For the A Text see 2859; for the C Text see 1913.
Subjects: charters, of Christ; devotional treatises; instruction, religious
_description: The ‘Long Charter of Christ’ (B text) — 414 lines in couplets

CULEe215.First Lines:
…Nowe derworthy Sowle herkyn to meAnd a newe Ioye I shall
                    telle the…
CULEe215.Last Lines:
…To that blysse I may the bryngeThat of nought made alle
                    thyng
CULEe215.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 46-81.

CULFf238.First Lines:
Who so will on rede this bokeAnd wyth hys goostly eye þeron
                    lokeTo odur scole dar he not wendeTo saue hys soule fro the
                    fende…
CULFf238.Last Lines:
…To blysse y may the bryngeThat of noght made all
                    thynge
CULFf238.Attributed Title: here foloweþ þe chartire of criste (f. 47vb)
CULFf238.Facsimiles:
McSparran,  Frances,  and  Pamela R. Robinson.  
             “Introduction.” 
             Cambridge University Library MS Ff.2.38.
         London: Scolar Press, 1979.
CULFf238.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 46-81.

CULIi326.First Lines:
Hho so euyr will rede this bokeAnd with gostly ey
                    thereyn loke…
CULIi326.Last Lines:
…to that blysse he may vs bryngeThat made of noȝt all
                    maner thynge
CULIi326.Attributed Title:
Bona carta gloriose passionis do / minum nostri Ihesu christi (f.
                        238ra); Explicit Carta Ihesu Cristi (f. 240)
CULIi326.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 46-81.

CULIi49.First Lines:
Ho so euyr wyll rede ouyr this bokeAnd wyth his gostely yere In
                    loke…
CULIi49.Last Lines:
…Be twen to iewes was I puttIhesu hygh g kynge of
                    ryght
CULIi49.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 46-81.

BlCottCalAII.First Lines:
Who so wyll ouer Rede thys bokeAnd with hys gostly ye þer on
                    loke…
BlCottCalAII.Last Lines:
…Ihesu yn þat holy placeGraunte vs to se þy holy
                    face
BlCottCalAII.Note:
‘Amen / Explicit’ by scribe at end, f.
                    79rb.
BlCottCalAII.Attributed Title:
Carta ihesu cristi (by scribe in upper margin, f. 77 and as RT on
                    verso leaves thereafter); Charta Jesu Christi (f. 1, sixteenth-century
                    list of contents)
BlCottCalAII.Editions:
Spalding,  Mary Caroline. 
             The Middle English Charters of Christ.
         Bryn Mawr, PA: Bryn Mawr College, 1914: 46-81.

BLHar2382.First Lines:
Wwoso wil ouer rede this bokeAnd with gostly eyen ther on
                    loke…
BLHar2382.Last Lines:
…To that blisse y may the bryngthat of myght made al
                    thyng
BLHar2382.Attributed Title:
Testamentum Cristi (ff. 112-118, as RT, by scribe); Explicit
                        Testamentum Cristi (f. 118, after end of text, by scribe)
BLHar2382.Editions:
Furnivall,  Frederick James,
                        ed.  
             The Minor Poems of the Vernon Manuscript, Part 2.
EETS
         o.s. 117 (1901; repr. 1973): 637-57.

HarRich22.First Lines:
Who so wole ouer rede þis bookeAnd wiþ his gostly
                    yȝe þereon lokeTo oþer scole þar he nat wendeTo
                    saue his sowle fro þe feende…
HarRich22.Last Lines:
…To þat blysse I may þe bryngeThat of nowht made all
                    þynge

Corning6.First Lines:
Who so wyll euer rede þis boke& with hys gostly eyen
                    þer on lokeTo oþer scole þer he not wendeTo save hys
                    soule from þe fende…
Corning6.Last Lines:
…To þat blys I maye þe bryngÞat of nouȝt
                    made all þyng

TokyoTak4.First Lines:
Who so will ouer rede this bokeAnd with his gostly eygh theron
                    loke…
TokyoTak4.Last Lines:
…To that blisse I may the bryngeThat of nought made alle
                    thynge
TokyoTak4.Note:
Second text after Speculum (MS unfoliated; follows table of
                    chapters of Speculum Vitae).
TokyoTak4.Attributed Title: The chartour of oure lorde Ihesu Crist

CantAdd46.First Lines:
who wyll euer rede……oulke to odyr scole there…he
                    wyn…
CantAdd46.Last Lines:
…for loue of the nyne monces with he y was to takemendys for
                    thy trespas or y yn to thyswordel was borneAmen
CantAdd46.Note:
The resized fragment bears a number ‘4’ what is the verso of
                    the leaf. Copied as prose.
CantAdd46.Editions:
Boffey,  Julia,  and  A. S. G. Edwards.  
             “Unrecorded Middle English Verse Texts in a Canterbury Cathedral Library
                Manuscript.” 
             Medium Ævum
         72 (2003): 49-62: 55.
